original_data.question: A 34-year-old male suffers from inherited hemophilia A. He and his wife have three unaffected daughters. What is the probability that the second daughter is a carrier of the disease?

model_response:
The probability that the second daughter is a carrier of the disease is 25%. This is because each child has a 50% chance of being a carrier and the order of birth does not affect the probability.

###Answer: OPTION B IS CORRECT.</s><s>

question_entities.definition: State of severe distress associated with events that threaten the intactness of the person, can be physical, mental, or emotional.
Transmitted through genes from parents to offspring. (genome.gov)
The classic hemophilia resulting from a deficiency of factor VIII. It is an inherited disorder of blood coagulation characterized by a permanent tendency to hemorrhage.
An intrinsic defect of erythrocytes inherited as an autosomal dominant trait. The erythrocytes assume an oval or elliptical shape.
This term applies to a family member in whom the diagnosis that is the primary focus of investigation is excluded. []
The study of chance processes or the relative frequency characterizing a chance process.
An individual who carries an inheritable genetic mutation without manifestation of the associated condition.
A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.
